metadata.title: Quantum Error Correction Data Sources Registry
metadata.purpose: Machine-readable registry of QEC datasets, tools, and access instructions

real_hardware_datasets.name: Google Sycamore Quantum Supremacy Data
real_hardware_datasets.description: Experimental data from quantum supremacy demonstration using 53-qubit Sycamore processor
real_hardware_datasets.access_method: Public download via Dryad repository link in paper

real_hardware_datasets.name: Google Willow - Below Threshold QEC
real_hardware_datasets.description: Surface code error correction below threshold using 105-qubit Willow processor
real_hardware_datasets.access_method: Not publicly available - only aggregate results in paper

real_hardware_datasets.name: IBM Quantum Experience Surface Codes
real_hardware_datasets.description: Surface code implementations on IBM quantum hardware with heavy-hexagonal lattice

specifications.task: Surface code implementations, magic state injection

real_hardware_datasets.data_format: QASM circuits, measurement results from live experiments
real_hardware_datasets.access_method: Sign up for IBM Quantum account, run experiments on simulators or hardware queue

real_hardware_datasets.name: Quantinuum H2 - 4D Surface Code
real_hardware_datasets.repository: H2 benchmark repo (general performance, not syndrome data)
real_hardware_datasets.description: First hardware demonstration of single-shot QEC using 4D surface codes on trapped-ion processor
real_hardware_datasets.access_method: Benchmark data in GitHub repo, but not raw syndrome measurements
limitations: Raw syndrome data not publicly released

research_paper_datasets.name: AlphaQubit: Learning High-Accuracy Error Decoding
research_paper_datasets.description: Recurrent transformer neural network for high-accuracy quantum error decoding

specifications.training_data_size: 100+ million synthetic samples + limited experimental data

data_generation.pretraining: Stim-generated synthetic data with circuit-level noise
data_generation.noise_model: Detector error models calibrated using cross-entropy benchmarking

research_paper_datasets.access_method: Check Nature supplementary materials, data availability statement in paper
limitations: Dataset not directly released as standalone package
No explicit GitHub repository found in search
Supplementary materials may require Nature subscription
Methodology described but data not packaged for download
research_paper_datasets.notes: Highly relevant - represents state-of-the-art approach. Paper describes methodology in detail. Check supplementary materials for possible data/code release.

research_paper_datasets.name: GNN-Based QEC Decoders (Lange et al.)
research_paper_datasets.description: Data-driven decoding of quantum error correcting codes using graph neural networks

specifications.noise_models: Circuit-level noise with depolarizing channels, cross-talk, leakage

data_generation.method: Stim simulator with detector error models
data_generation.noise_calibration: Pauli noise models calibrated to hardware

research_paper_datasets.access_method: Clone GitHub repos, regenerate data using provided scripts and Stim
limitations: Some repos provide code but not pre-generated data
research_paper_datasets.notes: Methodologies well-documented. Researchers expected to regenerate data. Stim is common tool across papers.

research_paper_datasets.name: Benchmarking Machine Learning Models for QEC
research_paper_datasets.description: Curated benchmark for assessing ML models' capacity to capture long-range dependencies in QEC

specifications.data_generation: Synthetic samples with detector error models

research_paper_datasets.access_method: Contact authors or check for associated GitHub repository
limitations: Dataset details may be in supplementary materials

synthetic_data_tools.name: Stim - Fast Stabilizer Circuit Simulator
synthetic_data_tools.description: High-performance stabilizer circuit simulator specialized for quantum error correction

performance.example: d=100 surface code (20K qubits, 8M gates) analyzed in 15 seconds

synthetic_data_tools.recommendation: PRIMARY TOOL - Industry standard for QEC simulation

synthetic_data_tools.name: PyMatching - Minimum Weight Perfect Matching Decoder

publication.title: PyMatching: A Python Package for Decoding Quantum Codes with Minimum-Weight Perfect Matching

synthetic_data_tools.description: Fast decoder for quantum error correcting codes using minimum-weight perfect matching
features: Constructs matching graphs from Stim DEMs
Decodes syndrome measurements to error predictions
Benchmark baseline for ML decoder comparison
Fast C++ implementation with Python interface
synthetic_data_tools.recommendation: ESSENTIAL - Companion to Stim for decoder validation

synthetic_data_tools.name: Qiskit Aer - Quantum Circuit Simulator
synthetic_data_tools.description: High-performance quantum circuit simulator with noise models
limitations: Slower than Stim for large-scale stabilizer simulation
Limited to smaller distances for full noisy simulation
synthetic_data_tools.recommendation: SUPPLEMENTARY - Useful for cross-validation and different noise models

synthetic_data_tools.name: Custom PauliSum Simulator
synthetic_data_tools.description: Lightweight Pauli-frame simulation for specialized research
synthetic_data_tools.recommendation: ONLY IF SPECIALIZED NEEDS - Not recommended for standard research
use_cases: Novel noise models not supported by Stim

public_repositories_searched.name: Kaggle
public_repositories_searched.findings: General quantum ML dataset exists (QDataSet) but no QEC-specific syndrome datasets

public_repositories_searched.name: UCI Machine Learning Repository
public_repositories_searched.findings: No quantum error correction datasets - focus on classical ML benchmarks

public_repositories_searched.name: GitHub Topics
public_repositories_searched.findings: Code repositories and tools found, but no centralized dataset repositories

public_repositories_searched.name: ArXiv
public_repositories_searched.findings: Papers describe methodology but datasets typically not archived - regenerable synthetic data is standard
public_repositories_searched.pattern: QEC research relies on locally generated synthetic data using documented methods

educational_resources.name: Google Quantum AI - Hands-on QEC Course
educational_resources.description: Course covering surface code implementation and Stim simulation

educational_resources.name: NordIQuEst - Surface Code Threshold Tutorial
educational_resources.description: Hands-on tutorial for estimating surface code threshold with Stim

educational_resources.name: Riverlane - Simulating Surface Codes with Stim
educational_resources.description: Comprehensive guide to surface code simulation

educational_resources.name: PyMatching Toric Code Example
educational_resources.description: Example of using Stim and PyMatching together for toric code decoding

recommendations.primary_strategy: Synthetic data generation using Stim simulator
justification: No real datasets exist for d≥11
Stim is industry standard (Google Quantum AI)
Methodology validated by top-tier research (Nature publications)
Unlimited data generation at any distance
Hardware validation possible at smaller scales (d=3,5,7)
recommendations.validation_approach: Compare d=3,5,7 synthetic results with published hardware benchmarks
next_steps: Calibrate noise models to match published error rates
